description: The traditional pantheon of elven civilization, centered around Corellon Larethian and his family. These gods represent the core values of elven society: art, magic, and nature.

deities.name: Corellon Larethian
deities.title: Creator of the Elves
deities.description: The chief god of the elves and the creator of the elven race. He represents art, magic, and the creative spirit.
deities.alabastria_context: Corellon's influence is strongest among elven communities and artists. His followers are often found among bards, wizards, and those who create beautiful things.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among elven settlers who sought to establish their art and magic in the new world, with his temples serving as centers of creativity and magic.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of elven communities across all continents, with his temples serving as centers of art and magic.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established the most prestigious magical and artistic institutions in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary creators and magical researchers across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains the most extensive network of art and magic in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary artists and magical researchers across all continents.

deities.name: Sehanine Moonbow
deities.title: Goddess of Dreams
deities.description: The goddess of dreams, journeys, and mysteries. She represents the elven connection to the ethereal and the unknown.
deities.alabastria_context: Sehanine's influence is strongest among elven rangers and those who journey. Her followers are often found among rangers, druids, and those who explore the unknown.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among elven rangers who sought to explore the new world, with her temples serving as centers of dreams and journeys.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of elven rangers across all continents, with her temples serving as centers of exploration and dreams.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established the most extensive network of exploration and dreams in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary rangers and explorers across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains the most extensive network of exploration and dreams in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary rangers and explorers across all continents.

deities.name: Hanali Celanil
deities.title: Goddess of Love
deities.description: The goddess of love, beauty, and romance. She represents the elven appreciation for beauty and love.
deities.alabastria_context: Hanali's influence is strongest among elven communities and those who appreciate beauty. Her followers are often found among artists, lovers, and those who seek beauty.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among elven communities who sought to maintain their culture of beauty and love in the new world, with her temples serving as centers of love and beauty.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of elven communities across all continents, with her temples serving as centers of love and beauty.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established the most extensive network of love and beauty in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary artists and lovers across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains the most extensive network of love and beauty in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary artists and lovers across all continents.

deities.name: Labelas Enoreth
deities.title: God of Time
deities.description: The god of time, wisdom, and longevity. He represents the elven connection to time and memory.
deities.alabastria_context: Labelas's influence is strongest among elven scholars and those who study history. His followers are often found among historians, scholars, and those who seek wisdom.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among elven scholars who sought to record the history of The Bringing, with his temples serving as centers of time and wisdom.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of elven scholars across all continents, with his temples serving as centers of time and wisdom.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established the most extensive network of time and wisdom in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary historians and scholars across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains the most extensive network of time and wisdom in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary historians and scholars across all continents.

deities.name: Solonor Thelandira
deities.title: God of Archery
deities.description: The god of archery, wilderness, and hunting. He represents the elven connection to nature and the hunt.
deities.alabastria_context: Solonor's influence is strongest among elven rangers and hunters. His followers are often found among rangers, hunters, and those who live in the wilderness.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among elven rangers who sought to hunt and explore the new world, with his temples serving as centers of archery and hunting.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of elven rangers across all continents, with his temples serving as centers of archery and hunting.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established the most extensive network of archery and hunting in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary rangers and hunters across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains the most extensive network of archery and hunting in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary rangers and hunters across all continents.

deities.name: Lolth
deities.title: Spider Queen
deities.description: The goddess of spiders, lies, and domination. She represents the dark side of elven society and the power of deception.
deities.alabastria_context: Lolth's influence is strongest among dark elves and those who seek power through deception. Her followers are often found among drow, rogues, and those who deal in lies.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among dark elves who sought to establish their power in the new world, with her temples serving as centers of deception and domination.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of dark elves across all continents, with her temples serving as centers of deception and domination.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established a network of deception and domination across all continents, with her followers being the primary deceivers and power seekers across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains a network of deception and domination in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary deceivers and power seekers across all continents.

deities.name: Vhaeraun
deities.title: God of Shadow
deities.description: The god of shadow, rebellion, and thievery. He represents the rebellious and thieving aspects of dark elven society.
deities.alabastria_context: Vhaeraun's influence is strongest among dark elves and those who rebel against authority. His followers are often found among rogues, rebels, and those who deal in shadows.
deities.temples: Hidden shrines and secret meeting places

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among dark elves who sought to rebel against the new world order, with his temples serving as centers of shadow and rebellion.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of dark elves across all continents, with his temples serving as centers of shadow and rebellion.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established a network of shadow and rebellion across all continents, with his followers being the primary rebels and thieves across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains a network of shadow and rebellion in Alabastria, with his followers being the primary rebels and thieves across all continents.

deities.name: Eilistraee
deities.title: Goddess of Song
deities.description: The goddess of song, redemption, and dance. She represents the hope for redemption among dark elves.
deities.alabastria_context: Eilistraee's influence is strongest among dark elves who seek redemption and those who appreciate music. Her followers are often found among bards, dancers, and those who seek redemption.

history_800_years.0-100_cycles: Gained followers among dark elves who sought redemption in the new world, with her temples serving as centers of song and redemption.
history_800_years.100-300_cycles: Became the patron of redeemed dark elves across all continents, with her temples serving as centers of song and redemption.
history_800_years.300-600_cycles: Established a network of song and redemption across all continents, with her followers being the primary bards and redemption seekers across all continents.
history_800_years.600-800_cycles: Currently maintains a network of song and redemption in Alabastria, with her followers being the primary bards and redemption seekers across all continents.
